trans-unit.source: Create an EDI bridge using BizTalk Services Portal
trans-unit.target: Create an EDI bridge using BizTalk Services Portal

trans-unit.source: How to create an EDI <token>bridge</token> in <token>af_integration</token>.
trans-unit.target: How to create an EDI <token>bridge</token> in <token>af_integration</token>.

trans-unit.source: EDI bridges are used to process X12 and EDIFACT messages.
trans-unit.target: EDI bridges are used to process X12 and EDIFACT messages.

trans-unit.source: You can create <token>bridge</token>s to process EDI messages directly from the <token>tpm_portal</token>.
trans-unit.target: You can create <token>bridge</token>s to process EDI messages directly from the <token>tpm_portal</token>.

trans-unit.source: Bridge configuration includes information such as which messaging transport to use, transforms (if required), and where the messages are routed.
trans-unit.target: Bridge configuration includes information such as which messaging transport to use, transforms (if required), and where the messages are routed.

trans-unit.source: The <token>bridge</token>s associate with the EDI agreements at runtime and use the EDI protocol-related settings that are defined as part of the agreement.
trans-unit.target: The <token>bridge</token>s associate with the EDI agreements at runtime and use the EDI protocol-related settings that are defined as part of the agreement.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="f3a8d261-0ada-4798-b079-68ede2cda850" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How do bridges associate with agreements at runtime?</link>
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="f3a8d261-0ada-4798-b079-68ede2cda850" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How do bridges associate with agreements at runtime?</link>

trans-unit.source: In the <token>tpm_portal</token>, click the <embeddedLabel>Bridges</embeddedLabel> tab, and then click <embeddedLabel>Add</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: In the <token>tpm_portal</token>, click the <embeddedLabel>Bridges</embeddedLabel> tab, and then click <embeddedLabel>Add</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In the General Settings tab, for <embeddedLabel>Protocol</embeddedLabel>, select <embeddedLabel>EDI</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: In the General Settings tab, for <embeddedLabel>Protocol</embeddedLabel>, select <embeddedLabel>EDI</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Under <embeddedLabel>Tracking</embeddedLabel>, enter how you want to track the messages:
trans-unit.target: Under <embeddedLabel>Tracking</embeddedLabel>, enter how you want to track the messages:

trans-unit.source: Track Send side message properties
trans-unit.target: Track Send side message properties

trans-unit.source: Check this to store the message properties when the EDI message is sent to the partner.
trans-unit.target: Check this to store the message properties when the EDI message is sent to the partner.

trans-unit.source: Once stored, you can query this data by clicking Tracking on the <token>tpm_portal</token> home page.
trans-unit.target: Once stored, you can query this data by clicking Tracking on the <token>tpm_portal</token> home page.

trans-unit.source: When enabled, you can also store the message body by checking <ui>Archive Send side message</ui> (Developer and Premium Editions only).
trans-unit.target: When enabled, you can also store the message body by checking <ui>Archive Send side message</ui> (Developer and Premium Editions only).

trans-unit.source: Track Receive side message properties
trans-unit.target: Track Receive side message properties

trans-unit.source: Check this to store the message properties when the EDI message is received from a partner.
trans-unit.target: Check this to store the message properties when the EDI message is received from a partner.

trans-unit.source: Once stored, you can query this data by clicking Tracking on the <token>tpm_portal</token> home page.
trans-unit.target: Once stored, you can query this data by clicking Tracking on the <token>tpm_portal</token> home page.

trans-unit.source: When enabled, you can also store the message body by checking <ui>Archive Receive side message</ui> (Developer and Premium Editions only).
trans-unit.target: When enabled, you can also store the message body by checking <ui>Archive Receive side message</ui> (Developer and Premium Editions only).

trans-unit.source: Expand <embeddedLabel>EDIFACT Delimiters</embeddedLabel> and provide the relevant values.
trans-unit.target: Expand <embeddedLabel>EDIFACT Delimiters</embeddedLabel> and provide the relevant values.

trans-unit.source: These values are used to parse the incoming EDIFACT message to retrieve partner identities, etc. Why do we only need EDIFACT delimiters and not X12?
trans-unit.target: These values are used to parse the incoming EDIFACT message to retrieve partner identities, etc. Why do we only need EDIFACT delimiters and not X12?

trans-unit.source: That’s because the ISA segment is mandatory in an X12 message and the bridge can extract the required delimiters from the ISA segment.
trans-unit.target: That’s because the ISA segment is mandatory in an X12 message and the bridge can extract the required delimiters from the ISA segment.

trans-unit.source: For EDIFACT, a UNA segment is optional.
trans-unit.target: For EDIFACT, a UNA segment is optional.

trans-unit.source: So, the bridge needs to be aware of the delimiters to use for parsing the message, in case the incoming EDIFACT message does not have the UNA segment.
trans-unit.target: So, the bridge needs to be aware of the delimiters to use for parsing the message, in case the incoming EDIFACT message does not have the UNA segment.

trans-unit.source: If the incoming EDIFACT message includes a UNA segment, the values you provide here will be ignored.
trans-unit.target: If the incoming EDIFACT message includes a UNA segment, the values you provide here will be ignored.

trans-unit.source: UNA1 (Component data element separator)
trans-unit.target: UNA1 (Component data element separator)

trans-unit.source: Enter a value for the component data element separator that separates simple data elements within composite data elements.
trans-unit.target: Enter a value for the component data element separator that separates simple data elements within composite data elements.

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>Char</embeddedLabel> for a character data element or <embeddedLabel>Hex</embeddedLabel> for a hexadecimal data element.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>Char</embeddedLabel> for a character data element or <embeddedLabel>Hex</embeddedLabel> for a hexadecimal data element.

trans-unit.source: The character you enter automatically changes if you change its format.
trans-unit.target: The character you enter automatically changes if you change its format.

trans-unit.source: UNA2 (Data element separator)
trans-unit.target: UNA2 (Data element separator)

trans-unit.source: Enter a value for the data element separator that separates composite data elements consisting of two or more simple data elements or simple data elements that are not part of a composite.
trans-unit.target: Enter a value for the data element separator that separates composite data elements consisting of two or more simple data elements or simple data elements that are not part of a composite.

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>Char</embeddedLabel> for a character data element or <embeddedLabel>Hex</embeddedLabel> for a hexadecimal data element.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>Char</embeddedLabel> for a character data element or <embeddedLabel>Hex</embeddedLabel> for a hexadecimal data element.

trans-unit.source: The character you enter automatically changes if you change its format.
trans-unit.target: The character you enter automatically changes if you change its format.

trans-unit.source: UNA3 (Decimal notation)
trans-unit.target: UNA3 (Decimal notation)

trans-unit.source: Specify whether you want to use a <embeddedLabel>Comma</embeddedLabel> or <embeddedLabel>Decimal</embeddedLabel> as the decimal notation to be used in the outgoing interchange.
trans-unit.target: Specify whether you want to use a <embeddedLabel>Comma</embeddedLabel> or <embeddedLabel>Decimal</embeddedLabel> as the decimal notation to be used in the outgoing interchange.

trans-unit.source: UNA4 (Release Indicator)
trans-unit.target: UNA4 (Release Indicator)

trans-unit.source: Enter a value for the release indicator that indicates that the following character is not a syntax separator, terminator, or release character, but is part of the original data.
trans-unit.target: Enter a value for the release indicator that indicates that the following character is not a syntax separator, terminator, or release character, but is part of the original data.

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>Char</embeddedLabel> for a character data element or <embeddedLabel>Hex</embeddedLabel> for a hexadecimal data element.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>Char</embeddedLabel> for a character data element or <embeddedLabel>Hex</embeddedLabel> for a hexadecimal data element.

trans-unit.source: The character you enter automatically changes if you change its format.
trans-unit.target: The character you enter automatically changes if you change its format.

trans-unit.source: UNA5 (Repetition Separator)
trans-unit.target: UNA5 (Repetition Separator)

trans-unit.source: Enter a value for the repetition separator that is used to separate segments that repeat within a transaction set.
trans-unit.target: Enter a value for the repetition separator that is used to separate segments that repeat within a transaction set.

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>Char</embeddedLabel> for a character data element or <embeddedLabel>Hex</embeddedLabel> for a hexadecimal data element.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>Char</embeddedLabel> for a character data element or <embeddedLabel>Hex</embeddedLabel> for a hexadecimal data element.

trans-unit.source: The character you enter automatically changes if you change its format.
trans-unit.target: The character you enter automatically changes if you change its format.

trans-unit.source: UNA6 (Segment Terminator)
trans-unit.target: UNA6 (Segment Terminator)

trans-unit.source: Enter a value for the segment terminator that indicates the end of an EDI segment.
trans-unit.target: Enter a value for the segment terminator that indicates the end of an EDI segment.

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>Char</embeddedLabel> for a character data element or <embeddedLabel>Hex</embeddedLabel> for a hexadecimal data element.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>Char</embeddedLabel> for a character data element or <embeddedLabel>Hex</embeddedLabel> for a hexadecimal data element.

trans-unit.source: The character you enter automatically changes if you change its format.
trans-unit.target: The character you enter automatically changes if you change its format.

trans-unit.source: Suffix
trans-unit.target: Suffix

trans-unit.source: Specify whether you want to use carriage return (CR), line feed (LF), both, or none as the end-of-line character that is used with the segment terminator.
trans-unit.target: Specify whether you want to use carriage return (CR), line feed (LF), both, or none as the end-of-line character that is used with the segment terminator.

trans-unit.source: Click <embeddedLabel>Continue</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Click <embeddedLabel>Continue</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Receive Settings</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>Send Settings</embeddedLabel> tabs are added.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Receive Settings</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>Send Settings</embeddedLabel> tabs are added.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="256222ee-5a82-442c-8ab3-d6434c2cc479" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">EDI Receive bridge settings in BizTalk Services Portal</link> and <link xlink:href="6872b02d-114f-4271-bc90-ce9df470ce97" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">EDI Send bridge settings in BizTalk Services Portal</link> to configure the receive and send settings.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="256222ee-5a82-442c-8ab3-d6434c2cc479" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">EDI Receive bridge settings in BizTalk Services Portal</link> and <link xlink:href="6872b02d-114f-4271-bc90-ce9df470ce97" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">EDI Send bridge settings in BizTalk Services Portal</link> to configure the receive and send settings.

trans-unit.source: Next
trans-unit.target: Next
